segment.source: Support Elypia
Elypia is a Community Interest Company
segment.target: Elypia est une société d'intérêt communautaire

segment.source: While we try to be sustainable through subscriptions and services, it's favorable to receive donations to keep everything as free as possible. As a non-profit, funding is what allows us to continue to develop free and open-source software and push to provide free or affordable services.

As a Community Interest Company we will also be able to generate income through selling subscriptions and services or by providing hosted solutions for our open-source projects. Donations will not be the only form of income for Elypia but strongly encouraged and appreciated.
Where do donations go?

At present most costs are for technical infrastructure or legal obligations to keep Elypia CIC and it's websites and services up. This includes domains, hosting, content delivery, travel or paperwork, and any annual fees or requirements in order to fulfill company wide obligations under legal justification. Some projects may incur costs if new assets or branding is desired for them. We are hopeful that in the future Elypia will be able to provide salaries to those contributing and managing Elypia's projects.

segment.target: On dirait que vous êtes nouveau ici, nous avons donc créé le formulaire d'inscription à votre place !

segment.source: Source Code
Copyright
We love free and open-source software!
We want to make enterprise grade software development simpler to learn and utilize, and to support sectors that aren't up-to-date or stuck by legacy proprietary abandonware.
Introduction

Elypia CIC is a non-profit Community Interest Company based in the United Kingdom that wants to bring more free and open-source software to different sectors. This is starting with software development, aimed at junior developers, and will hopefully move towards other areas outside of software that may aid educational institutions or less developed sectors attain alternatives over abandoned legacy applications.
Legal

A Community Interest Company is a non-profit organization in the United Kingdom which has the structure of a limited company, but pledges to use its surplus for community benefit, as opposed to the benefit of its directors. As a CIC, Elypia has a responsibility to follow its Articles of Association and Community Interest Statement which can both be found on the Companies House website. All projects Elypia takes on will adhere to the objectives in the aforementioned documents.
Mission

Elypia wants to aid the future of software and technology by providing FOSS (free and open-source software) to the public free of charge. We want to see more libraries and frameworks that allow junior developers to create enterprise grade applications for small-scale purposes, ready to take that knowledge with them to support other projects and businesses. We also want to help create modern, secure, and reliable software, that can be referenced or derived from for small businesses without worrying about legacy applications that are no longer supported with no viable or affordable alternative.
Privacy Policy
Last updated on 1st August 2019
segment.target: Dernière mise à jour le 1er août 2019

segment.source: This privacy policy will try cover a broad range of Elypia's websites and services. It may be a good idea to check if a particular service you're curious about has it's own policy on top of this general one.

The Elypia website currently doesn't store any information on users, however the web server that is running the webpage you are viewing right now will have logged basic information about your connection such as IP address.
ePrivacy Directive

We try to minimize the use of cookies or local storage where possible without reducing the functionality if the website or services. Due to this we don't add any tracking or analytics cookies so see what you do nor send that data to advertisers.
We are embedding code from other websites so they may also add cookies while your browse this website, for example Discord or FontAwesome.
This is a manual list that notes down all (or at least most) cookies (or localstorage and session storage) that's in active use.
Projects
Alexis is a free and open-source multi-purpose chatbot for Discord and provides various integrations and moderation features to help you have fun, and automate manage and moderation of your guild!
Commandler is a generic command handling framework for Java that allows you to write your code once and integrate it anywhere or multiple places in a single application.
Commandler will handle all the work so it keeps implementing commands quick and simple while the bulk of the work is handled by the framework.
Confiler is a small service which can be online or self-hosted, it's a cloud configuration service which will allow users to define entities to process or store configuration for them.
This is great for applications where you want to have a UI for users to tailor their experience without having to write your own web service dedicated to the generic job we all need.
Elypiai is a small but useful library that provides wraps for many APIs available online that don't already have official implementations.
All wraps have been abstracted as to make it more consistent between web services you're implementing and maximize pooling resources.
The Elypia Emotes are a free and open-source set of cute red panda emoticons available under the Apache license.
You can download, modify, reference, or redistribute them as you see fit for any purpose, including commercial.
Source
